articles.title: Most coronavirus cases are mild, complicating the response - The Washington Post

articles.content: Health authorities managing the outbreak are trying to understand what that critical fact portends. Are the 45,000 sick people tallied so far just a portion of a vast reservoir of uncounted victims, some of whom may be spreadingthe disease? And do the mild il… [+6470 chars]

articles.author: Jeanne Whalen
articles.title: Coronavirus fears force cancellation of giant tech conference in Spain - The Washington Post
articles.description: The event, MWC Barcelona, is the telecommunications sector’s biggest annual gathering. Last year more than 100,000 people attended, including many from China.
articles.content:
Global concern regarding the coronavirus outbreak, travel concern and other circumstances, make it impossible for the GSMA to hold the event, the telecommunications-industry group said.
The news came after a string of high-profile companies dropped out of th… [+809 chars]

articles.author: Anna Fifield
articles.title: Despite China's appeal for a return to work, it's business as unusual in Beijing
articles.description: In a journalist's neighborhood, the noodle shop was shut. So was the fruit seller. And the hardware guy. And the nail salon.
articles.content: Normally thousands of subway passengers from the nearby station would be drop by to buy something, said Nancy Cao, 25-year-old clerk who was wearing a face masks and gloves as she worked in a convenience store in Beijings Capital Mall. Its usually packed, but… [+6926 chars]

articles.author: Tory Newmyer
articles.title: The Finance 202: Federal Reserve’s Jay Powell predicts some coronavirus hit to U.S. But he won’t respond just yet.
articles.description: There’s now a higher chance of an interest rate cut in June.

articles.author: James Heintz and Daria Litvinova | AP
articles.title: 2 Russians flee virus quarantine, in dismay at hospitals
articles.description: Two Russian women who were quarantined for possible inflection by a new virus say they fled their hospitals this month because of uncooperative doctors, poor conditions and fear they would become infected
articles.content: The incidents occurred amid the outbreak of the virus in China that has already infected more than 40,000 people worldwide. In Russia, only two cases of COVID-19 have been reported. Nevertheless, the authorities took vast measures to prevent the new disease f… [+4269 chars]

articles.description: Millions remain in lockdown across the country as the death toll rises. Elsewhere, Singapore's largest bank evacuated staff after a confirmed case of the virus.

articles.title: China's Chernobyl? The coronavirus outbreak leads to a loaded metaphor.
articles.description: The scale of the crisis has led to an existentially troubling historical parallel.
articles.content: But for Chinese President Xi Jinping, the public health emergency is only the tip of the crisis. Before appearing in front of cameras on Monday at a Beijing clinic, Xi had been conspicuously absent, opting instead to let his deputies become the public face of… [+4911 chars]

articles.author: Joe McDonald | AP
articles.title: China's new virus cases fall again, deaths now exceed 1,100
articles.description: China has reported another drop in the number of new cases of a viral infection and 97 more deaths, pushing the total dead past 1,100 even as the country remains largely closed down to prevent the spread of the disease
articles.content:
The 97 additional deaths from the virus raised the mainland toll to 1,113.
Despite the official end o the extended Lunar New Year holiday, China remained mostly closed for business as many remained at home, with some 60 million people under virtual quarantin… [+4177 chars]
